page.title: 01 Levenmouth
page.content: Our area is in Fife on the east of Scotland in the midland belt.It includes Leven and Methil which lie at the mouth of the River Leven where it flows into the Firth of Forth.They form part of a group of towns known as Levenmouth. Leven lies on the N.E side of the river.There was once a natural harbour here but extensive silting up occured,land reclamation took place and now houses, shops and a car park lie where ships used to berth. Methil lies on the S. side of the river and was created as a port in 1869. The combined population of the two is approximately 27000 people. Lying 55 kilometres N.NE of Edinburgh there is easy access to both larger towns and open countryside.
